Defines

Application parameters
#define APP_PAIRING_TIMEOUT   (5000000/FAP_RX_PERIOD)
 Definition of the period the host shall enable pairing after power up.
Common host/device parameters
#define WDP_MAX_UL_PL_LENGTH   32
 Defines the maximum uplink payload length to be used.
#define WDP_MAX_DL_PL_LENGTH   32
 Defines the maximum downlink payload length to be used.
#define WDP_PAIRING_ADDRESS   {12, 15, 65, 32, 26}
 Definition of the global pairing address to be used for exchanging pairing information.
#define WDP_PAIRING_CHANNELS   {3, 34, 54, 61, 78}
 Definition of the global subset of channels to be used for exchanging pairing information.
#define WDP_INIT_MASTER_ADDRESS   {0, 0, 3, 3}
 Definition of the initial value for the "random" master address generator.
#define WDP_CH_HIGH   80
 Definition of highest frequency channel to be used when generating channel subset.
#define WDP_CH_LOW   2
 Definition of highest frequency channel to be used when generating channel subset.
#define WDP_MOUSE_KA_INTERVAL   (1000000/FAP_RX_PERIOD)
 Definition of the interval between each "keep alive" message for a mouse when continuous link activated.
#define WDP_KEYBOARD_KA_INTERVAL   (1000000/FAP_RX_PERIOD)
 Definition of the interval between each "keep alive" message for a keyboard when a continuous link activated.
#define WDP_REMOTE_KA_INTERVAL   (1000000/FAP_RX_PERIOD)
 Definition of the interval between each "keep alive" message for a remote control when continuous link activated.
Device specific parameters
#define WDP_DEVICE_TYPE   WDP_MOUSE
 Definition of device type.
#define WDP_PAIRING_OUTPUT_POWER   HAL_NRF_18DBM
 Definition of the output power to be used by a device when sending a pairing request.
#define WDP_TX_DATA_TIMEOUT   (500000/FAP_MAX_TX_PERIOD)
 Definition of the timeout period for application user data transmission.
#define WDP_TX_PAIRING_TIMEOUT   (50000/FAP_MAX_TX_PERIOD)
 Definition of the timeout period for pairing request transmission.
Frequency Agility Protocol (FAP) parameters
#define FAP_CH_TAB_SIZE   5
 Specifies the number of frequency channels to be used for the frequency agility protocol.
#define FAP_CHANNELS   {24, 48, 72, 96, 120}
 Specifies the Frequency channels to be used for the frequency agility protocol.
#define FAP_RX_PERIOD   800
 Specifies the time in [us] the receiver shall listen on each channel during receive channel rotation.
#define FAP_NRF_AUTO_RETRIES   11
 Specifies the number of auto retransmit attempts to be used for the nRF radio.
#define FAP_AUTO_RETRIES_EXTEND   2
 Specifies a multiplication factor in order to extend the number of retransmits set up by FAP_NRF_AUTO_RETRIES.
#define FAP_MAX_FW_PL_LENGTH   WDP_MAX_UL_PL_LENGTH+1
 Specifies the maximum payload length ever to be used for device to host transmission.
#define FAP_MAX_ACK_PL_LENGTH   WDP_MAX_DL_PL_LENGTH
 Specifies the maximum payload length ever to be used for the ACK payload.
#define FAP_RX_CH_HOLD_PERIODS   5
 Specifies the number of FAP_RX_PERIOD the receive channel rotation shall be halted after data is received.
#define FAP_TIMER_MODIFY_PERIOD   (FAP_RX_PERIOD - 150)
 Specifies the value to be used when adjusting the FAP timer after every successful transmission.
#define FAP_LP_RX_POLL_PERIOD   (500000/FAP_RX_PERIOD)
 Speceifies the duration between each "receive burst" when using the receive low power mode.

Detailed Description

Setup parameters for Nordic Wireless Desktop Protocol (WDP) nRF24LU1 demo.

Author:
Lasse Olsen

Definition in file wdp_setup.h.

Define Documentation

#define APP_PAIRING_TIMEOUT   (5000000/FAP_RX_PERIOD)

Definition of the period the host shall enable pairing after power up.

Definition at line 30 of file wdp_setup.h.

#define WDP_MAX_UL_PL_LENGTH   32

Defines the maximum uplink payload length to be used.

The device application should never exceed this number when writing uplink data using wdp_send_data().

Definition at line 41 of file wdp_setup.h.

#define WDP_MAX_DL_PL_LENGTH   32

Defines the maximum downlink payload length to be used.

The host application should never exceed this number when writing downlink data using wdp_write_downlink_data().

Definition at line 115 of file wdp_setup.h.

#define FAP_CH_TAB_SIZE   5

Specifies the number of frequency channels to be used for the frequency agility protocol.

The number of channels should be set as high as possible in order to increase the robustness against co-existing radio sources. However, a large number of frequency channels will increase the average transmission latency.

Definition at line 128 of file wdp_setup.h.

Referenced by fap_get_ch_offset(), fap_nrf_isr_function(), fap_set_channels(), and fap_timer_isr_function().

#define FAP_CHANNELS   {24, 48, 72, 96, 120}

Specifies the Frequency channels to be used for the frequency agility protocol.

The number of channels should be the same as the FAP_CH_TAB_SIZE defined above.

Definition at line 136 of file wdp_setup.h.

#define FAP_RX_PERIOD   800

Specifies the time in [us] the receiver shall listen on each channel during receive channel rotation.

Definition at line 142 of file wdp_setup.h.

#define FAP_NRF_AUTO_RETRIES   11

Specifies the number of auto retransmit attempts to be used for the nRF radio.

Definition at line 148 of file wdp_setup.h.

Referenced by fap_init(), and fap_nrf_isr_function().

#define FAP_AUTO_RETRIES_EXTEND   2

Specifies a multiplication factor in order to extend the number of retransmits set up by FAP_NRF_AUTO_RETRIES.

The nRF radio has a limited number of auto retransmit attempts. The total number of transmit attempts on a single channel before channel switch will equal (FAP_NRF_AUTO_RETRIES+1)*FAP_AUTO_RETRIES_EXTEND.

Definition at line 156 of file wdp_setup.h.

Referenced by fap_nrf_isr_function().

#define FAP_MAX_FW_PL_LENGTH   WDP_MAX_UL_PL_LENGTH+1

Specifies the maximum payload length ever to be used for device to host transmission.

Definition at line 161 of file wdp_setup.h.

Referenced by fap_tx_data().

#define FAP_MAX_ACK_PL_LENGTH   WDP_MAX_DL_PL_LENGTH

Specifies the maximum payload length ever to be used for the ACK payload.

This constant is used to decide whether 250 or 500 us retransmit delay is to be used, as a long ACK payload requires longer retransmit delay.

Definition at line 168 of file wdp_setup.h.

Referenced by fap_write_ack_pload().

#define FAP_RX_CH_HOLD_PERIODS   5

Specifies the number of FAP_RX_PERIOD the receive channel rotation shall be halted after data is received.

It is recommended that this is set > 0 to ensure that acknowledge transmission is completed before channel rotation continues.

Definition at line 175 of file wdp_setup.h.

Referenced by fap_nrf_isr_function().

#define FAP_TIMER_MODIFY_PERIOD   (FAP_RX_PERIOD - 150)

Specifies the value to be used when adjusting the FAP timer after every successful transmission.

When using the synchronization mechanisms offered by the FAP, this value must be tuned so that the the average number of retransmit equal ~0. (During good radio conditions). A sennsible value using as a starting point for this value is given as FAP_RX_PERIOD - FAP_MAX_PL_LENGTH. This parameter can only be optimized for one payload length.

Definition at line 186 of file wdp_setup.h.

Referenced by fap_modify_timer_period().

#define FAP_LP_RX_POLL_PERIOD   (500000/FAP_RX_PERIOD)

Speceifies the duration between each "receive burst" when using the receive low power mode.

This constants is specified in units of FAP_RX_PERIODs which in turn are specified in [us]. Thus, the duration between each "receive burst" will equal FAP_LP_RX_POLL_PERIOD*FAP_RX_PERIOD [us].

Definition at line 207 of file wdp_setup.h.

Referenced by fap_timer_isr_function().
